prompt: <description>Part 1: A long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles are set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees, and the translation vector is set to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Start by creating a 2D sketch for face 1 of this part. 1. Create a line (line\\_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.0] and end point at [0.0016, 0.0]. 2. Create an arc (arc\\_1) with the following parameters: - Start Point: [0.0016, 0.0] - Mid Point: [0.005, 0.007] - End Point: [0.0062, 0.0147] 3. Create a line (line\\_2) with a start point at [0.0062, 0.0147] and end point at [0.0, 0.0147]. 4. Complete the loop (loop\\_1) with a line (line\\_3) closing it by connecting the end of line\\_2 to the start of line\\_1 at [0.0, 0.0]. Create another 2D sketch for face 2, following loop and line conventions as above. 1. Create a line (line\\_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.0147] and end point at [0.0062, 0.0147]. 2. Create an arc (arc\\_1) with the following parameters: - Start Point: [0.0062, 0.0147] - Mid Point: [0.005, 0.0224] - End Point: [0.0016, 0.0293] 3. Create a line (line\\_2) with a start point at [0.0016, 0.0293] and end point at [0.0, 0.0293]. 4. Complete the loop (loop\\_1) with a line (line\\_3) closing it by connecting the end of line\\_2 to the start of line\\_1 at [0.0, 0.0147]. Proceed with scaling the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale value of 0.0293. Then transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector stated in the coordinate system. The part should be extruded at a depth of 0.75 (towards the normal) and 0.0 (opposite the normal) relative to the sketch's plane, creating a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end. The final dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.0293 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0293 units</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side with a central hole** 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1. 3. Draw a circle on the sketch with center at [0.375, 0.375] and radius 0.375. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.03 units towards the normal. The operation is to create a new solid body. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.1875, 0.1875, 0.03]. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1. 3. Draw a circle on the sketch with center at [0.1875, 0.1875] and radius 0.1875. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.375. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.1875 units towards the normal. The operation is to join the existing body. **Part 3: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and translation vector [0.585, 0.4875, 0.0]. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1. 3. Draw four lines on the sketch: * Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.105, 0.0]. * Line 2: Start point [0.105, 0.0], end point [0.105, 0.225]. * Line 3: Start point [0.105, 0.225], end point [0.0, 0.225]. * Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.225], end point [0.0, 0.0]. 4. The loop consists of 4 lines. 5. Scale the sketch by 0.225. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.0375 units opposite the normal. The operation is to cut the existing body.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector: [0.0, 0.3932, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. * Draw line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3316, 0.0]. * Draw line_2: Start Point [0.3316, 0.0], End Point [0.3316, 0.379]. * Draw line_3: Start Point [0.3316, 0.379], End Point [0.0, 0.379]. * Draw line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.379], End Point [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.379 in all directions using `sketch_scale` parameter. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0237 units, creating a 3D model of the rectangular prism. Part 2: Tapered Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a tapered three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector: [0.0711, 0.4122, 0.0237]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. * Draw line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0095, 0.0]. * Draw line_2: Start Point [0.0095, 0.0], End Point [0.0095, 0.2004]. * Draw line_3: Start Point [0.0095, 0.2004], End Point [0.0, 0.2004]. * Draw line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2004], End Point [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.2004 in all directions using `sketch_scale` parameter. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.2004 units, creating a 3D model of the tapered rectangular prism. Part 3: Cylindrical Object with Rectangular Hole Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, connected to two cylindrical rods on either side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation vector: [0.0711, 0.5937, 0.0426] 2. Draw five circles in total across face_1, face_2, face_3, face_4, and face_5 with radii 0.0078 and 0.0497. 3. Scale the 2D sketch using `sketch_scale` parameter as 0.1625. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the opposite direction of the normal direction by 0.1184 units, creating a 3D model of the cylindrical object with the rectangular hole in it.</description>
